key_points: A Michigan judge has ordered Ethan Crumbley, the boy charged in the Oxford High School shooting, to be moved from a juvenile facility to a county jail.
Crumbley, 15, is charged as an adult with murder, attempted murder, terrorism causing death, and gun crimes, and will be held without bond.
The shooting at Oxford High School resulted in four students killed and seven others injured.
Prosecutor Karen McDonald stated the shooting was premeditated, based partially on a significant amount of digital evidence.
Oakland County Sheriff's Lt. Tim Willis revealed Crumbley recorded a video discussing his plan to shoot and kill students the night before the incident.
Crumbley's parents were called to the school due to concerning behavior hours before the shooting, but he remained in school.
Prosecutor McDonald emphasized the need for new gun laws, citing the incident as a wake-up call.
Charges are being considered against Crumbley's parents for not securing the gun properly.
The names of the four students who were killed have been released.
The community expresses grief and calls for action at a vigil and through media interviews.
spokespersons: Tim Willis (Lt., Oakland County Sheriff's Department)
